review:
The main menu of this game took two minutes to load, which was already longer than the game took to download. 

The first/tutorial level took three minutes to load, and according to the in game timer, only 2 minutes and 18 seconds to complete - standard tutorial fare, right click to walk here, left click to shoot, grab a few guys who follow you, left click to have your guys shoot stuff. 

Why are the characters so inaccurate? It usually took two or three bursts of fire from my four guys to hit a stationary target point blank.

The second level took 6.5 minutes to load, according to my stopwatch. I closed the game and uninstalled it. I can't see this game getting patched, so I really can't recommend it to anyone ever. I luckily only paid about 50 cents for it, but I don't think it was worth that much for the experience I had with it, I'm afraid. I can't believe they charge 15 dollars for it.

I'd be glad to try it again if it gets some updates, though, it seems cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017744567', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1636130367}
review:
Cannon Fodder 3, like the previous two games, is a fun war game romp through various levels of increasing difficulty. You start off with a certain amount of troops that will travel with you through level to level mindful if you can keep them alive that is. Either point and click, use WASD, or a gamepad to control your team. Fire weapons and throw grenades. Hop into various vehicles and engage with the various details in the background. 

Graphics are top down 3D, which is reminiscent of the previous first 2D games. Details are fun and colorful. Visuals are not stunning but they entirely serve the purpose to this games main groove and mojo - a colorful rendition, with touches of various details and humor, of a serious topic splattered (no pun intended) throughout. 

Sound is somewhat repetive and I miss the various absurd death screams from the first game in particular  - which were hilarious . Here they are more subdued but still serviceable to their goal and are fun to be sure.

I don't know why many people have not heard of this series; perhaps it has slipped under the radar for most people. I highly recommend it and hope to see a new Cannon Fodder 4 in the future with the return of the poor, enemy soldier death screams that were so comical to the first in the series. :-)

review:
Das Spiel ist eigentlich grundsätzlich gut. 
Viele Reviews sagen das es ganz anders ist als der erste und zweite Teil. 
Das kann ich für meinen Teil überhaupt nicht nachvollziehen!?
Cannon Fodder 3 liefert das was der erste und zweite Teil geboten haben. 
Ja es ist nicht genauso ... soviel sollte jedem klar sein. 
Die Figuren heißen anders und der Song/Melodie des Originals ist auch nicht drin.
Copyright und vieles Andere machten dem logischer Weise einen Strich durch die Rechnung. 
Außerdem ist Teil 3 in 3D und die ersten Spiele sind Pixelart. 
Ist vielleicht ähnlich wie bei Comics und Animationsserien.
Garfield im Comic kommt auch super rüber und die 3D Serie ist weder sarkastisch noch zynisch ... also für kleinere Kinder geschaffen. 
Hier verhält es sich ähnlich. 
Wer das Original mochte wird von 3D abgeschreckt. 
Dennoch ist Teil 3 nicht so viel anders als die Vorgänger.
Insofern liegt eigentlich ein Daumen hoch vor. 

ABER ... und nun kommt es ... wie kann es sein das die Programmierer es nicht gesch***en bekommen haben das Problem der bis zu 10 minütigen Ladezeiten zu fixen???
Die Lösung des Problems ist zwar da ... von der Community ... man muss die INI Datei editieren.
Siehe Post im Forum unter "Mega Long Load Times"!
Dennoch finde ich es eine Zumutung dies selber tun zu müssen. 
Einen so gravierenden Bug hätte die Firma selber richten müssen. 
Sich so aus dem Staub zu machen ist sprichwörtlich zum kot**n! 
Ebenso die Tatsache das man festgelegte 30 FPS hat im Spiel. 
Unabhängig von der Einstellung VSynch. 
Egal ob man in 4K spielt oder in 1080P oder niedriger ... die FPS sind bei 30 FPS in Stein gemeißelt. 
Damals vielleicht bei alten Grafikkarten nicht weiter auffällig ... aber mit einem Ryzen 7 und einer halbwegs brauchbaren GTX 1080 die selbst bei Spielen wie Godfall 80 FPS bringt ein NoGo. 

Dies beides lässt nur ein Symbol zu ... nämlich den Daumen runter. 
Eigentlich beide Daumen runter. 
Einen für die Technische Katastrophe und einen dafür das dadurch ein eigentlich gutes Spiel zunichte gemacht wurde und der Kult und die Hoffnung auf Teil 4 völlig im Eimer ist.

review:
Since I havent been able to find any guide for this game, I made one myself, you can download it here:
https://juntau.denniskrog.dk/guides/cannon-fodder-3

I was going into the game a bit unaware of what to expect, but I quickly got caught up in doing it all the achivements, but I think it is more like how my brain function. But the game  is tense and exciting if you are trying to get all achivements. Only bad thing I can say is when the big General is giving you messages it takes up way to much of the screen where thouse messages could be a bit smaller.

Some missions are quick and easy to get though others require a bit more thinking to get them done. You need to remember your arsenal of weapons to get past some areas.

One other thing is the music is the same all the way through the game, sometimes you don't hear it maybe because the mission you are on fits the music but once you get into next mission you realize that its the same song, a few more tracks could be nice. I think the music producer was a fan of Command & Conquer, cause thats the first I think of when I listen to the music.

I havent played Cannon Fodder 1 & 2 as much as I maybe should have done. And after I have complete Cannon Fodder 3 I definitely will go back and try the first two.

If there is something I want to point out is, that I installed this game on an SSD harddrive and I edited the fix as mention under guides for the game, and still I had long loading times which I think is weird. 

If you just want a casual and quick playthrough it can be done in a few hours, but if you want to get all in-game achivements you are in for about 16-20 hours of gameplay depending on how good you are. It can be very frustrating sometimes because of the RnG of items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124576797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2246, 'last_played': 1705533919}
review:
This is a fun game that you don't need to think too much about.

Yes, it's true that it takes an unbelievably long time to load between levels.  It's no exaggeration to say there's ample time to make a cup of tea, boil an egg and make toast in the time it takes to load. I've done it!  I considered giving it a thumbs down for that reason.  But the truth is there are faster and newer games that are so much less fun than Cannon Fodder 3 and I could spend hours on an inferior modern game, be far less entertained and have no time between levels in which to chuck the hoover round or feed the cat or whatever.

Other reviewers have compared it to the original Cannon Fodder and I can see why they were generally disappointed but this is essentially the same game with some modifications. There are a whole load of new weapons, gimmicks and vehicles that, on the whole, look good and are fun to try but hardly help you complete the missions at all. But I don't mind that.

There's something strange about the way the game scrolls which is reminiscent of trying focus on the landscape whizzing past you while you're facing forward on a fast moving train which is distracting and irritating and takes some getting used to. 

It's not hard to play and not hard progress through the levels but I don't play this game for a challenge. I play it to veg out.  So, I would recommend this game for those times when you just need a distraction and you don't want something that's going to take up too much brainpower.

review:
First of all, no Jools, Jops and Stoo. It's a shame, but not so tragic.

Cannon Fodder, I remember once in my childhood playing it on my first pc.

I also want to mention that you should not compare parts 1&2 with this part here, otherwise you will probably be bitterly disappointed by part 3. A childhood memory cannot be toped.

But now to the actual game, this is a review of Cannon Fodder 3.

The game principle is as simple as ingenious, you control a squad soldier ( at best 4 ) through the mission, blow up houses, shoot down soldiers, collect upgrades, weapons and grenades.

That explains the game principle, the controls are good and I got along with it very well, graphically the game is certainly not up to date but perfectly ok, exploding things are no rarity.
In one or the other mission you may drive vehicles or even fly a helicopter and shoot everything from the air.

The humor doesn't get a raw deal here and there, especially the intro put a smile on my face.

All in all, I can definitely recommend it for in between.

"War has never been so much fun!"

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057252542', 'num_games_owned': 4533, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1575806224}
review:
I have fond memories of Cannon Fodder 1 and to some extent, 2. However my memory of their near perfection isn't quite the reality and after revisiting them on GOG.com I was sad to find out that they have some glaring flaws some 30 years after the initial release. Not taking anything away from the original titles, I love them dearly, but they're harder to enjoy today.

Cannon Fodder 3 (not from original team), also has its own flaws but as a package I actually found myself having a lot of fun. It keeps the core concept of Cannon Fodder 1 and 2 but gives it a much needed modern splash of paint.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
- Fun and fluid gameplay
- Bright, colourful and detailed graphics
- Classic mouse only or keyboard and mouse controls
- Full building destruction and fun use of explosives
- Ultrawide resolution and aspect ratio support (rare for even AAA devs today)
- Built-in achievements
- Decent cutscenes and humour


[h1]CONS[/h1]
- 2-3 minute loading times per mission (can be easily fixed, check guides)
- Boring and generic soundtrack
- Poor translation and voice acting
- Loose and floaty camera
- No Steam features (achievements/cloud saves etc.)
- Seemingly broken multiplayer?

[b]Summary[/b]

Cannon Fodder 3 isn't perfect but without wearing rose tinted glass, neither were the first two. There's many 'spiritual successors' and shameless copies of Cannon Fodder and while I've given a lot of them a fair shot, I actually think the official third title gets closest to the classics, failing that possibly Tiny Troopers.

I got the game in a bundle and having paid full price I might have felt a little disappointed, but for the couple quid I paid, I'm more than happy with what I got. Get it on sale and give it a chance.

review:
I love Cannon Fodder and have played through that game many times.  It is great.  

No, Cannon Fodder 3 is not as good as Cannon Fodder, but I still enjoyed playing it.  It is not as frantic as the original for a few reasons.  Your soldiers have a few hit points, so you can take a few stray bullets here and there without losing your troops.  In the original your soldiers were far more fragile.  Also, in the original enemies might kill you when they are barely within the extreme edge of your vision.  In this version, taking your time can easily save you from danger.  It slows the game down, but to me does not lower the excitement enough to make it not enjoyable.

review:
Ну що сказати. Головна проблема цієї гри в тому, що це ніякий не "Cannon Fodder". Елемент стратегії відсутній взагалі, а ворогів набагато більше. Власне, більш схоже на "Alien Shooter".

Ще одним суттєвий фейлом є те, що грати на геймпаді просто неможливо, проте на клаво-миші грається доволі приємно.
Ну і дивує відсутність російської локалізації, враховуючи що саме росіяни розробляли "Cannon Fodder 3".

Але в усьому іншому, гра зовсім так - нічого (в хорошому сенсі).
Графіка - напівмультяшна, на рівні "Red Alert 3". Більш того, тут вона навіть більш доречна. Анімація - також доволі приємна: будівлі красиво розсипаються від вибуху підкладеного динаміту, підстрелені бочки із паливом літають по мапі, здетоновані ящики з боєприпасами тріщать та іскряться…
Музика чудово вписується в темп гри. А трек із зимової локації - просто крутезний (кавер на "Э-э-й ухнем").

Геймплей доволі динамічний, хоча лізти в купу ворогів я б все-таки не радив.
По мапах розкидано багацько усіляких бонусів: від аптечок до ядерної зброї.

От чого не вистачає цій грі, так це мультиків між рівнями, на кшталт стартової заставки. Таким чином могли б навіть якийсь простенький сюжетик додати.

Отож, "Cannon Fodder 3" я можу порадити як цілком вдалого "убивцю часу". Проте, наголошую, що це ніякий НЕ "Cannon Fodder"!!! Думаючи інакше, тільки зіпсуєте собі враження.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027795106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1474235681}
review:
It's a budget game made by unknown Russian developers. Also, it's not the Cannon Fodder sequel anyone has been waiting for. However, I have very high tolerate for budget games made by unknown developers so I decided to try it anyway.

I found the game interesting enough to play it for 10 hours until I completed it. The game was OK, for £4 I paid it was good enough. It is a typical budget game. Voice acting is terrible, music is the most generic electro guitar tune on repeat, controls are bad (use WASD and mouse together!), story incoherent and ridiculous, graphics are OK but soldiers look truly hideous with small bodies and huge ugly heads. Oh, and the game literally calls you "retarded" in few missions... However, that did now surprise me as I knew to expect no better from this game. On the other hand if you can look past all this its OK little shooter. Gameplay is simple, repetitive yet somehow addictive. Its fun killing waves of enemies making huge chain explosions. Difficulty level is just right. Original Cannon Fodder was tough as nails but this one is much easier which I appreciate. There are some vehicles some levels and its quite fun driving those. Suppose you just got back from work. You are quite tired and don't have energy to play something demanding on your brain. You just want to veg-out and pass some time playing something really simple. This game is perfect for that! 

Finally, do I recommend it? It depends. Is the game on sale and less than fiver and can you tolerate budget games? Have you already played Cannon Fodder I & II and Tiny Troopers? If the answer to all these questions is yes then sure go for it. Otherwise, you will be disappointed.

review:
I enjoyed the original Cannon Fodder for the Amiga.  I had hoped that this would help me reclaim the feel of that classic game, but instead it's like someone took the basic concept of the original and then put a "2003" era spin on it. 

[h1]Things that bugged me about this game[/h1]
[list]
[*] instead of having cool music, it's the most generic electric guitar riffs you could imagine
[*] the characters look like those "spittin image" puppets
[*] aforementioned puppets will run through a standard talking animation while the voiceover plays 
[*] all the charm of the original is gone
[*] loading times straight out of the PS1 era (seriously? How? Why?)
[*] the bullet animation is really really pathetic. 
[/list]

[h1]Some things I liked about this game[/h1]
[list]
[*] At the minimum it plays a little like the original game
[*] The Grenades seemed cool
[/list]

There just isn't that much to love about this game, and a whole lot of little things to dislike (but not hate).  Imagine if someone told you to take this song by Mozart and somehow update it so that "kids today" would like it.  You could try to compose an original tune in his style, but instead you decide it's not worth the effort so you take [b]Variations on "Ah, vous dirai-je, Maman"[/b] in a midi file and play it through a cheap synth.  Does it sound like Mozart? Well, yeah, but somehow it's just a cheezy version of twinkle twinkle little star instead.

That's how this game feels.  Cheezy.

Edit:  Thanks to Kudi, there's a fix for the poor load times.  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=517468131

I'll have to revisit this game and see if that changes my opinion of it for the better.  The load times were one of the main reasons I couldn't stand this game.

---- GERMAN REVIEW ----

Zu aller erst … Kein Jools, Jops und Stoo. Schade eigentlich aber nicht so tragisch.

Cannon Fodder, ich erinnere mich, wie ich es einst in meiner Kindheit heimlich auf dem Amiga meines Bruders gespielt habe.

Ebenfalls möchte ich hier noch erwähnen dass man die Teile 1&2 nicht mit diesem Teil hier vergleichen sollte, ansonsten wird man vermutlich von Teil 3 bitter enttäuscht.

Nun aber zum eigentlich Spiel, hier geht es schließlich um eine Review zu Cannon Fodder 3.

Das Spielprinzip ist so simpel wie genial, man Steuert ein Squad Soldaten ( bestenfalls 4 ) durch die Mission, jagt Häuser in die Luft, schießt Soldaten ab, sammelt Upgrades, Waffen und Granaten ein.

Damit wäre das Spielprinzip eigentlich auch schon erklärt, die Steuerung ist gut und ich kam damit bestens zurecht, Grafisch ist das Spiel sicherlich nicht auf dem aller neusten Stand aber vollkommen in Ordnung, explodierende Dinge sind keine Seltenheit.
In der ein oder anderen Mission darf man auch mal Fahrzeuge fahren oder gar einen Helikopter fliegen und aus der Luft alles zerschießen.
Ein Kritikpunkt für mich ist hier vor allem der sehr einfache Schwierigkeitsgrad selbst auf „Schwer“, allerdings kann es auch an meiner Erwartung von „Schwer“ gelegen haben.

Der Humor kommt hier und da nicht zu kurz, vor allem das Intro hat mir direkt ein lächeln ins Gesicht gezaubert.

Im großen und ganzen kann ich es für zwischendurch durchaus empfehlen.

Kommen wir mal zum Preis, ich muss zugeben 19€ sind dann doch etwas zu viel, ich würde empfehlen es im Angebot für 50-75% zu kaufen, rund 10€ ist es dann schon wert.

Den Koop-Modus habe ich nur einmal kurz angetestet, er hat funktioniert, mehr kann ich dazu allerdings nicht sagen.

„War has never been so much fun!“


TL:DR

7/10

+ Gameplay
+ Spaß
+ Grafik & Sound
+ Humor / Intro
+ Koop


- Preis
- Ladezeit
- Schwierigkeitsgrad

author: {'steamid': '76561198013282050', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1692547361}
review:
Jeu d’action en 3D isométrique dans la lignée de ses prédécesseurs avec la possibilité de diriger ses hommes avec le clavier QZSD en combinaison avec la souris et de prendre part à la campagne en coopération en ligne jusqu’à 4 joueurs.

Pour : l’esprit cannon fodder est bien là (le cimetière, l’hélicoptère pour introduire les missions, les tonneaux qui partent au hasard après avoir explosés, les pièges), 27 missions dans différents environnements (sur mer, dans le désert, sur la lune, dans une station spatiale) qui prennent 10-15h si vous essayez de garder tous vos soldats en vie, graphismes honnêtes avec de quelques bons effets visuels (par exemple le lance flammes), des armes intéressantes, des véhicules à conduire, l’ambiance sonore est bien rendue, la coopération en ligne.

Contre : la caméra est fixe, les musiques sont limitées à deux et bien qu’entrainantes au début, elles deviennent vite lassantes, quelques bugs residuels, une traduction russe -> anglaise plus qu’approximative, un scénario vite oublié, des cut scènes en 3D plutôt bien faites mais qui n’apportent pas grand chose, une intelligence artificielle très basique, un temps de chargement anormalement long sous Win7, pas de succès sous Steam, pas d’intégration de Steamworks pour le jeu en ligne.

A noter que le multijoueur utilisait GameSpy, dont les serveurs viennent de s’arrêter de façon définitive donc il n’est plus possible de jouer en multijoueur !

Je recommande ce jeu à tous les nostalgiques de la grande époque de l’Amiga, sur lequel sont d’abord sorti les Cannon Fodder 1 et 2 de la fabuleuse équipe de Sensible Software, avant d’être adapté sur toutes les plateformes du moment. Tout ce qui leur manquait était un mode coop et c’est maintenant chose faite (enfin quand Gamespy aura eu un remplaçant).

review: I managed to get this for a dollar during a sale, and I regret even spending that much.  The game is horribly optimized (un-ending loading screens, without progress bars to let you know how long you're going to sit and listen to the looping, faux-metal).  Having played the original Cannon Fodder to death on an old 486 PC, I can barely believe the people that made this game have any clue what made the original so much fun.  I poured hours into mastering the original's levels, so that I could make it through with my entire squad alive, taking Jools, Jops, et al as far as I could.  Grenades and rockets were a valued commodity, and placing them just right on enemy buildings made combat an almost puzzle-like experience.  None of that was present in what little portion of this game I was willing to suffer through before quitting.  Originally excited to see that this was being made; then disappointed that I heard it wasn't good enough to spend $20 on; then excited to find it on sale for $1; and now, back to disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970683850', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1400944713}
review:
Got this game in a sale for mere pence, thinking it's surely worth that, right? Wrong. If you've got any nostalgia for the original at all, you will be disappointed with this.

The low-rent intro sequence kicks things off and before you know it, you're awkardly shifting your troops around to an ill-concieved metal soundtrack while taking orders from a general who is clearly voiced by a British man sitting in a biscuit tin occasionally doing an American accent.

When he's not talking, all you hear are your soldier's footsteps that always sound like they are walking through hospital corridors no matter what the terrain. Even the misison script is written by someone who must've left school when they were 12. Example: "There are six mission crates hidden in the area! See if you can find it!"

Not to mention the multiplayer is Gamespy, which is no longer even active.

Cannon Fodder is easy to get right, but somehow these developers managed to get it so, so wrong. Presumably because they made it for a bag of chips, as that's the only excuse I can see for the poor production value. Making it in Flash would've been better.
